X-Hive/DB 7.0.0

Uses of Package
org.w3c.dom.as

Packages that use org.w3c.dom.as
com.xhive.dom.interfaces This package contains the library interfaces (for collections of documents) and X-Hive specific extensions to the W3C DOM Interfaces, as well as interfaces related to special DOM related data. 
com.xhive.dom.xlink.interfaces This package contains W3C XLink convenience classes: (1) a utility class with basic link-resolution, link-expansion and link-management functions (2) a DOM XLink API where users can retrieve XLink information from DOM nodes. 
org.w3c.dom.as These are the interfaces of the DOM Abstract Schema specification. 
 

Classes in org.w3c.dom.as used by com.xhive.dom.interfaces
ASDOMBuilder
          An Abstract Schema parser interface.
ASModel
          To begin with, an abstract schema is a generic structure that could contain both internal and external subsets.
DocumentAS
          This interface extends the Document interface with additional methods for both document and AS editing.
DOMASWriter
          A Abstract Schema serialization interface.
 

Classes in org.w3c.dom.as used by com.xhive.dom.xlink.interfaces
DocumentAS
          This interface extends the Document interface with additional methods for both document and AS editing.
 

Classes in org.w3c.dom.as used by org.w3c.dom.as
ASAttributeDecl
          An attribute declaration in the context of a ASObject.
ASContentModel
          The content model of a declared element.
ASDataType
          The datatypes supported by DOM AS implementations.
ASElementDecl
          The element name along with the content specification in the context of an ASObject.
ASEntityDecl
          Models a general entity declaration in an abstract schema.
ASException
          Abstract Schemas operations may throw a DOMSystemException as described in their descriptions.
ASModel
          To begin with, an abstract schema is a generic structure that could contain both internal and external subsets.
ASNamedObjectMap
          Objects implementing the ASNamedObjectMap interface are used to represent collections of abstract schema objects that can be accessed by name.
ASNotationDecl
          This interface represents a notation declaration.
ASObject
          The ASObject interface is analogous to a Node in , e.g., an element declaration.
ASObjectList
          The ASObjectList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of AS objects, without defining or constraining how this collection is implemented.
